title.narrative: Capacity Building for Devolution through UNDP
Capacity building for Devolution through UNDP

description.narrative: Programmet syftar till att stödja genomförandet av en decentraliserad stat och därigenom åstadkomma en bättre samhällsstyrning och en förbättrad socioekonomisk utveckling i Kenya. Det baseras på FN:s initiativ 'Delivering as One' och FN:s strategi för decentralisering, samt även på Kenyas medellånga plan II och det övergripande ramverk för kapacitetsutbyggande i samband med decentralisering som ministeriet för decentralisering och planering utformat. Programmet kommer att bidra till att det nås resultat enligt FN:s ramverk för utvecklingssamarbete (UNDAF), resultat 1.3, samt enligt landsprogramdokumentet, resultat 2, gällande decentralisering och ansvarighet. I programmet ingår fem resultatområden, vilka ska genomföras enligt årsarbetsplaner som utgår från vilken sorts kapacitetsuppbyggande som behövs allteftersom genomförandet fortskrider. Arbetet bygger ofta vidare på tidigare aktiviteter. Den modell för årlig arbetsplanering och budgetering som används vid genomförandet av det vidare resultatramverket medger flexibilitet. Detta för att det ska gå att svara mot olika behov av kapacitetsuppbyggande och för att man stegvis ska kunna bygga vidare på det som redan åstadkommits. Varje år kommer prioriteringar som gäller insatsens övergripande syfte gemensamt att identifieras och beslutas av implementerande parter och UNDP för att sedan sammanfattas i ett resultatramverk med tydliga delresultat. Årsarbetsplanen ska ligga

The 2010 constitution established a two level governance, comprising a national government and 47 County governments. The constitution also established other institutions critical to the success of devolution. The new structure of governance came into place after the 2013 general elections. Most of the institutions created are new and starting off from scratch and their capacity needs to be strengthened in order for them to play their rightful role of ensuring devolution becomes a reality. The government of Kenya has since put in place the policy, legal and institutional framework for the implementation of devolution. Through MTP 2, the government has prioritized the full implementation of the constitution to ensure rapid set up of Counties without disruption of service delivery. At the same time, the GOK has prioritized capacity development and alignment at both County and National levels. This intervention will be contributing to efforts by the governemnt of Kenya to enhance the capacity of County Governments and other related institutions to play their part in ensuring devolution succeeeds. It will be implemnted through UNDP with funding from several partners including USAID, DFID, Norway, Demark and Sweden. The EU and Finaland are also considering joining. Its objective will be to support the implementation of devolved government to achieve improved governance and socio economic development. Its approach will be capacity building which is often used as an overall concept for the conditions that must be in place, for example knowledge, competent, effective, and oriented organisational and institutional frameworks, neccesary to make development possible. The intervention will be implemented over a period of five years..
The projet objective is to support the implementation of devolved government to achieve improved governance and socio- economic development in Kenya.

title.narrative: Decision Amendment Capacity Building for Devolution through UNDP.

description.narrative: Overall, the project has contributed to the achievemnt of results in all results' areas: - Policies, laws and institutional reforms for effective implementation of the 2010 Consitution have been developed, adopted and undertaken; - institutional and human capacities at national and county levels supporting national and local development have been strengthened; - evdence-based planning and budgeting for improved service delivery at county level has been strengthened; - citizen participation mechanisms and processes to ensure effective and equitable service delivery and people-centred devolved system of government have been strengthened; - and and integrated service delivery framework pilot has been implemented. Some of the outcomes are that 100% of supported counties have their budgets approved by the Controller of Budget, more than 80% of kenyans support devolution and the figure is increasing over time, more gender-sensitive standards are being implemented within the county governments, and all counties supported have functional mechanisms for citizens' engagement.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
